definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out

sentences.english: Two hours later, Mr Wu woke up feeling groggy and uneasy.
sentences.chinese: 兩個小時後，伍醒了，感到腦袋發暈且很不舒服。

sentences.english: My blood froze and I felt weak and faint.
sentences.chinese: 我嚇得渾身冰涼，感到身子虛弱，頭腦發暈。

sentences.english: He felt faint at the sight of blood.
In this from the equator very near the sun and flower lets a person feel dizzy.
sentences.chinese: 在這離赤道很近的地方陽光和鮮花一樣讓人發暈。

sentences.english: My head began to spin after three glasses of wine.
sentences.chinese: 三杯酒落肚，我的頭開始發暈了。

sentences.english: His muse pullulated with dizzying speed.
sentences.chinese: 他的靈感以令人發暈的速度滋長着。

sentences.english: She has acrophobia and always becomes dizzy in a high-rise elevator.
sentences.chinese: 她有恐高症，到了高樓的電梯裏就發暈。
